data.question: What is the highest experimental pore volume reported among all the porphyrinic MOFs?
Which metal ions were used in the synthesis of PCN-600 series?
What is the stability range of pH values for PCN-600 in aqueous solutions?
What is the synthesis temperature for PCN-600?
What method was used for the activation of PCN-600?
What is the role of PCN-600(Fe) in catalysis?
data.answer: It acts as a peroxidase mimic to catalyze the co-oxidation reaction.

data.question: How does the structure of PCN-600 contribute to its catalytic activity?
data.answer: Its mesoporous structure with large open channels and high concentration of porphyrins provides active centers for catalysis.

data.question: Why is Fe(III) considered an ideal metal ion for constructing nodes in MOFs?
data.answer: Due to its low toxicity, abundance, and hard Lewis acidity which results in stronger coordinating bonds with carboxylates.

data.question: Is PCN-600 stable under basic aqueous conditions?
Does PCN-600 require a phase change when used as a heterogeneous catalyst in solution?
Is the activation of PCN-600 successful through direct methods?
Can PCN-600 survive conditions of both acidic and basic aqueous solutions?
Is PCN-600 the only mesoporous porphyrinic MOF known to be stable under basic conditions?
Does the synthesis of PCN-600 involve the use of a preassembled [Fe3O(OOCCH3)6] building block?
Is the pore volume of PCN-600 lower than the calculated value?
Does the chemical stability of PCN-600 mainly come from its Fe3O(OOC)6 cluster?
What is the synthesis method for PCN-600?
data.answer: Solvothermal reactions of M-TCPP (M = Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu), [Fe3O(OOCCH3)6(OH)], and trifluoroacetic acid in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) at 150 °C for 12 h.

data.question: What is the experimental BET surface area of PCN-600(Fe)?
What is the decomposition temperature of PCN-600 samples?
What is the role of H3O+ and OH- in the activation process of PCN-600?
data.answer: They help to decompose the coordination compounds stuck in the channels, making them removable by water and DMF.
